title: Signing does not work, even the certificate is shown
content:
Context : W11 / Thunderbird : 115.3.2

Dear, For months now I've been unable to send emails signed by my personal certificate issued by the Belgian government (eID). This certificate works perfectly for all authentications managed directly or indirectly by the state.

The reader seems to be well installed and fulfilling its mission. The certificate is visible ...

I have attached 3 Screen Copies

Questions

1) Previous versions of had a security option called signature. I can't find this option in this version. How can I sign a message with a certificate?

2) If you select the right option (see question 1), the signature doesn't seem to work. This was already the case with previous versions of Thunderbird (as a reminder, it has worked in the past).

Can you help? No support seems to be available from the authorities producing the addon or applications specific to the Belgian eID.

Thank you very much for your advice, Marc
creator: MarcVN

title: Thunderbirds Filtreleri
content:
Merhaba, Bir kaç gün önce Thunderbirds programım güncellendi. Arayüzü tamamen değişti. Güncellemeden önceki programda hızlı filtreler sorunsuz çalışıyordu. Fakat güncellemeden sonra özellikle "Konu" ve "Gövde" filtre seçenekleri yazdığım kelimeye göre filtreleme yapmıyor. Ekteki resimde ahmet kelimesini aratıyorum. Fakat 2 ileti yazmasına rağmen aşağıda bana gelen tüm mailler listeleniyor. Kesinlikle filtreleme yapmıyor. Aynı şey "gönderen" ve "alıcılar" için geçerli değil. Onlar çalışıyor. Mesela mail adresi yazdığımda gönderen seçtiğimde o mail adresinden gelen tüm mailler listeleniyor. "Konu" ve "Gövde" filtreleri neden çalışmıyor?


Hello,

A few days ago, my Thunderbirds program was updated, and the interface was completely changed. The quick filters were working perfectly fine in the previous version of the program. However, after the update, especially the "Subject" and "Body" filter options are not filtering messages based on the words I enter. In the attached image, I am searching for the word "ahmet". However, despite having only 2 messages, all emails received by me are listed below. It's definitely not filtering. The same issue does not apply to "sender" and "recipients". They are working. For example, when I enter an email address and select sender, all emails from that email address are listed. Why aren't the "Subject" and "Body" filters working?

title: new thunderbird email app
content: I much preferred the older version of thunderbird... on this one I can't see how to put a 'tag' icon on the header, so have to do right click on the email to bring up the drop down menu and then tag items. Also when I search CTRL+K - instead of just being able to click on any one of the emails brought up in the list and send a reply - when I click on it, it brings up in a long list (the thread) and then I have to scroll down to find the one I want - which will always be the last one because I'm just looking for the last message to reply to. it was so easy and simple before and now you've made it completely confusing and complicated and I'm fed up and having a moan about it. Somehow also the text is more difficult to read and I don't trust it in the same way I did the previous version. Wish I'd not updated. So, how do I put a 'tag' icon in the header bar, so I can easily tag my emails? I guess there's nothing I can do about the additional steps I have to take now, when I want to locate the last email I sent or received - I will always get the thread and have to scroll down to the last one. But I can see the thread if I open up the last email, so why do I need a separate pile of thread messages? that's just a moan about having additional and unnecessary steps added.

Another problem is with the Address book : I have dozens of entries with the same e-mail addresses. When I try to erase all but one, it only erases a couple of them and then no others get deleted when I try again. I have been using Thunderbird for over 15 years - more than 10 years the Portableapps form. My data folder is 37GB in size (every mail since I started using Thunderbird). Another issue is that the sender names are not displayed as should be, I have "Prefer display name over message header" checked for every recorded address but it shows like I was receiving mail dorm this contact for the first time .... Still love Thunderbird (currently v115.3.1 64bit) but this is becoming more than a nuisance, this IMAP account is my main business address and I need to continue using it efficiently.

Thank you in advance and pardon me if the netiquette is not quite right. It is the first time I have asked for help (because I could not find similar cases to solve it myself).

Have a nice day, Erich

title: Adding calendar subscription from a 365/Outlook calendar in an 365/Outlook account
content:
When a 365/Outlook calendar is shared to a different account, the access options are more limited when it is to a different calendar provider (e.g., when sharing to a Google account, it might allow you to see availability, while when shared to a 365/Outlook calendar it might allow to see title/location to those accounts outside your organization). Many organizations restrict access to 365/Outlook accounts outside closed systems but allow the calendar to be shared to personal devices and such.

In Thunderbird, you can add calendars by connecting the account or when that is not an option through adding a calendar from the network (e.g., private iCal address). The way Outlook calendars share the subscription invitation is through a sharing_metadata.xml file such as: ``` <SharingMessage xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/sharing/2008"> 

 <DataType>calendar</DataType>  <Initiator>    <Name>Name is owner account</Name>    <SmtpAddress>YourName@YourOrg.domain</SmtpAddress>    <EntryId>...</EntryId>  </Initiator>  <Invitation>    <Providers>      <Provider Type="ms-exchange-external" TargetRecipients="PersonalOutlookemail@host.domain">        <FolderId xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/sharing/2008">...=</FolderId>        <EncryptedSharedFolderDataCollection xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/messages">          <EncryptedSharedFolderData xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/exchange/services/2006/types">            <Token>              <EncryptedData Type="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#Element" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#">                <EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#tripledes-cbc" />                <ds:KeyInfo xmlns:ds="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">                  <EncryptedKey>                    <EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-oaep-mgf1p">                      <ds:DigestMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#sha1" />                    </EncryptionMethod>                    <ds:KeyInfo>                      <wsse:SecurityTokenReference xmlns:wsse="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-wssecurity-secext-1.0.xsd">                        <wsse:KeyIdentifier ValueType="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-x509-token-profile-1.0#X509SubjectKeyIdentifier" EncodingType="http://docs.oasis-open.org/wss/2004/01/oasis-200401-wss-soap-message-security-1.0#Base64Binary">...=</wsse:KeyIdentifier>                      </wsse:SecurityTokenReference>                    </ds:KeyInfo>                    <CipherData>                      <CipherValue>...</CipherValue>                    </CipherData>                  </EncryptedKey>                </ds:KeyInfo>                <CipherData>                  <CipherValue>...</CipherValue>                </CipherData>              </EncryptedData>            </Token>            <Data>              <EncryptedData Type="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#Element" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#">                <EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes256-cbc" />                <KeyInfo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">                  <EncryptedKey xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#">                    <EncryptionMethod Algorithm="http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-tripledes" />                    <KeyInfo xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/09/xmldsig#">                      <KeyName>key</KeyName>                    </KeyInfo>                    <CipherData>                      <CipherValue>...</CipherValue>                    </CipherData>                  </EncryptedKey>                </KeyInfo>                <CipherData>                  <CipherValue>...</CipherValue>                </CipherData>              </EncryptedData>            </Data>          </EncryptedSharedFolderData>        </EncryptedSharedFolderDataCollection>      </Provider>    </Providers>  </Invitation>

</SharingMessage> ``` Somehow at some point I was able to get the calendar location based on the encrypted data. Does anyone know how I can decrypt it to get the information needed to add the subscription or if Thunderbird could eventually do that automatically?
creator: Nosferican

content: I am considering installing thunderbird as my email account w/outlook 2021. Before I do these are my questions? Is Thunderbird a web-based email platform? Can I addon Norton spam filters? title: Cambio sfondo/testo
content: Ho appena installato l'ultima versione di Linux Mint 21.2 Mate, scaricato Thunderbird ed esso appare di default TUTTO con sfondo nero e testo bianco, preferirei la visualizzazione classica con sfondo bianco e testo nero. Menú>impostazioni>generale>lingua e aspetto>caratteri e colori>colori Nei quadratini che appaiono il testo é GIÁ selezionato sul nero e lo sfondo sul bianco (?????) Ho spuntato la casella "utilizza colori personalizzati" , "sostituisci i colori specificati nella pagina con quelli selezionati" con selezionato "sempre". Cambiando i quadratini su qualsiasi colore seguito da seleziona>OK non succede assolutamente nulla, ovvero accetta il comando ma i colori dello sfondo e del testo rimangono invariati con sfondo nero e testo bianco, provato e riprovato in tutti i modi ma niente da fare, i colori sono bloccati cosí su tutto Thunderbird indipendentemente dal colore dei quadratini (ho provato varie combinazioni). La dimensione dei caratteri invece si puó cambiare senza problemi (e anche tutte le altre impostazioni sembrano funzionare correttamente). Il computer momentaneamente non é collegato alla rete internet (mancanza di cavo ethernet attualmente in utilizzo su altra macchina) ma non credo che per rendere effettivi i cambiamenti sia necessario un collegamento alla rete...(lo accenno "just in case"). Anche in menú>impostazioni>composizione i quadratini sono GIÀ testo nero e sfondo bianco ma il messaggio é a sfondo nero e testo bianco. Devo dire che a parte Thunderbird questa versione di Mint appare di default con sfondo nero e testi bianchi, sono riuscito a cambiare il tutto tranne che nella barra degli strumenti dove riesco a cambiare lo sfondo ma non il testo che rimane bianco non lasciando molte opzioni se non lo sfondo di detta barra nero o comunque scuro. Grazie a chi vorrá rispondere.
creator: aconita

title: Thunderbird very slow downloading and reading emails from gmail
content:
I use gmail with Thunderbird. It was working fine up until maybe 3 weeks ago. now, it takes a very long time to download the messages, and even when the DL stops, opening an email often results in just a white pane. When it finally populates, if you try to go to another email, it just sits on the current open email. It takes a minute or more to finally open.

My download speed on my system is 600mbps .

What could be the problem and how to fix it. I'm already to the point of ditching Thunderbird, which I've used for a very long time, and just go straight to gmail website.
creator: dasoumis72

title: Thunderbird 115.3.2 64-bit is displaying HTML content from the wrong messages
content:
Thunderbird appears to be displaying content from incorrect emails, and to be displaying that content incorrectly for many emails in my inbox.

For example, I have an email from a friend with the subject "coming your way", and when I click on that subject in my inbox I see the content of a different email I received from my son's college. The "Subject" displayed in the reading pane is "coming your way" but the body of the letter is completely unrelated.

In another example, I received an email from The Washington Post notifying me about one of their articles, and when I click on the subject for that email, I see the raw email headers followed by text from a completely different email from a club to which I belong.

In addition, Thunderbird appears to be interpreting unencrypted email bodies as having been partially encrypted with OpenPGP. I have PGP enabled, and I have a valid private/public key pair, but the emails Thunderbird is "partially decrypting" weren't encrypted to begin with.

The correlation between email subjects and bodies in my inbox appears to be corrupted for many of my emails, and those email bodies are shown as raw SMTP headers followed by HTTP, even though I have "View ... Message Body As ... Original HTML" selected.

This behavior has only been occurring after Thunderbird automatically updated to v115.3.2 64-bit. My operating system is Windows 11 Pro 22H2 Build 22621.2428.

I've been using Thunderbird for years if not decades, and I've never seen behavior like this before. Help, please!

-Brian Kasper bpkasper@gmail.com
creator: bpkasper

title: Email from whitelisted senders still lands in spam folder
content:
My first filter is shown in the attachment. Any email I receive from someone in my personal address book should be allowed through, but I continually find them in the spam folder, or deleted. What I *THINK* I am doing is:

Is the sender of the email in my PAB? If so, Tell Thunderbird it isn't junk (Since Thunderbird can't seem to figure this out.) Make sure it stays in the inbox 

       (also useful when I have to run it on my junk and deleted folders to resurrect emails I want.)

Go on to the next message without further considering the remaining filters on this one.

Remaining filters work correctly, as near as I can tell. For example, I have the BigSpammers filter for those who persist in emailing me, in the attached image. I have two filters to eliminate Top Level Domains I don't want to hear from. (I don't know anyone in Botswana, and so I don't read any emails from Botswana.)

title: Moving folders back and forth to Unified Folder causing issues
content:
I thought I could continue to "unify" multiple email folders by dragging folders from one inbox to the unified area on top. My goal was to have one set of working folders at the top that I could organize emails.

Seems that managing folders in the Unified "all mail" area is not a good idea and I was seeing strange dupliate emails so I decided to move them back. After my first batch of folders were moved, I proceeded to start moving them back down to the original inbox.

They are hanging at the moment, in process of moving but I'm seeing all sorts of odd behavior especially in the original gmail account. See visuals.

The original Gmail account is also a combined inbox using the same emails. I think this must be a big mistake and could cause weird duplication as well.

Big, big tangled up mess. I feel like I want to start over completely - yikes!

Advice on how to best get out of this mess?

title: Pasting image into email error - 'Thunderbird has blocked a file from loading into this message'
content:
When pasting an image into a message, copied to the clipboard from another email message in Thunderbird, I get an error message saying 'Thunderbird has blocked a file from loading into this message. Unblocking the file will include it in your sent message.'

This is not a remote file, it has just been copied from another Thunderbird message into the clipboard. There is an Options button which shows the file location showing mailbox:///c:/users/(username etc).

In Tools/Settings/Privacy/Mail Content, I have ticked the 'Allow remote content in messages.'

In Exceptions, I have tried to add 'mailbox:///c:/users/' as a permitted location. Doesn't help. I still get the error message. It's a nuisance to have to dismiss it every time.

This is a new problem since upgrading to 115.3.1 (64-bit)

Thanks for your help.
creator: brianstokes

title: MS Exchange (Outlook) account disappearing when exiting Thunderbird
content:
Sorry this post is a bit verbose !

Thunderbird automatically updated two days ago, version now 115.3.2. I use it to work with a number of mail accounts, including an MS Exchange account. All worked OK before the Thunderbird update. Exquilla version is 115.3 and paid up.

After the Thunderbird update I found that the MS Exchange account had disappeared from Thunderbird. Re-adding this account through the Account Wizard appeared to work OK. But after successfully verifying my account, on the final "Congratulations window" it said to click Finish to save settings and exit account wizard. There was no Finish button to click on, only Back, Next and Cancel ones (see screenshot). Clicked Next : window disappeared.

And yes the MS Exchange account was then accessible in Thunderbird, and it synced OK (it's all still there online), and I could work with it, but only as long as I didn't exit Thunderbird ! When I re-loaded Thunderbird later after exiting it, the MS Exchange account was absent again. Contrary to what was stated, the account had not been saved. Tried this several times - same result.

This issue only affects my MS Exchange account : none of my gmail accounts nor my Xtra account were affected.

Have other people had the same problem ? If so, is this being looked into ? It would be very annoying to have to add the MS Exchange account again each time I load Thunderbird.

Thanks a lot for any help, Emile.
creator: ejbax

title: Search bar function opens waaaaay too many emails
content:
Here is a quote from What's New In Thunderbird 115:

Click a message in the search results to view it.

It will open in a new tab, along with other messages that have the same Subject.

Your original search will be left unchanged in the search tab, so you can go back and continue searching


That second sentence is the problem -- "along with other messages etc"

I would like to be able to click on ONE of the messages that comes up in search, and not have ALL of them open in separate tabs or windows. This is a huge fail. Such a nuisance to have to close a whole bunch of messages that I didn't intend to open in the first place.

Some help with this Please?
creator: bluetreesgreentrees

title: Protonmail Error-Current Operation on Inbox Did Not Succeed-Mail Server for Account Responded No Such Mailbox
content:
When opening the Inbox for my Protonmail address, Thunderbird has the following error: "The current operation on "Inbox" did not succeed. The mail server for account "xxxx@protonmail.com" responded: no such mailbox." All other mailbox folders for the address are working (i.e. sending, receiving and syncing without error). This started after upgrading to Version 115.3.1 "Supernova". I am running Thunderbird in Windows 10. Clicking on "Repair Folder" in Folder Properties did not help and produced the same error.

Any help correcting this is greatly appreciated.
